channel.title: Dr. Marissa Barlaz
channel.description: Recent content on Dr. Marissa Barlaz

item.title: Text Mining with R
item.description: Setting up an API Mining and Processing Searching for tweets Comparing three Twitter Users Processing Data Word Ratios Frequencies of key words Sentiment analysis Comparing tweets with certain search terms Processing data Locations and time series Another example of multiple search terms Time and Space Sentiments A few final words Setting up an API The first thing to do with R when getting ready to do Twitter mining is to set up your credentials.

item.title: R Graphing Workshop
item.description: Data Aesthetics Faceting Statistical Transformations Other Aspects of the graph Colors Labels, titles, and Axes Theme Wrapping up The aim of this workshop is to teach you the ins and outs of using the ggplot2 package in R. The materials for this workshop can be found here. A lot of the information in this workshop is based on workshops given at Harvard: https://dss.iq.harvard.edu/workshop-materials Please make good use of the following cheat sheet!

item.title: Data Processing with the Tidyverse
item.description: Why the tidyverse? Tidy data Components of the tidyverse Importing data The pipe operator Data Manipulation with dplyr Filter Arrange Select Mutate group_by Summarise Tidying data with tidyr Shapes of data Gather Spread Separate Unite Relating different data sets with dplyr Mutating Joins Filtering joins My data processing code Why the tidyverse? There are a few reasons to use R and the Tidyverse for data processing.

item.title: Introduction to R and RMarkdown
item.description: R as a calculator Variables Functions Data Frames Subsetting RMarkdown Formatting Bullet Points #Welcome to R! You might be asking, why should I use R instead of another type of software? In addition to being able to do statistics (like in Minitab, SPSS, Stata, etc.), you can do high-level scripting, statistical programming, and exploratory data analysis in R. It is free and open-source, meaning there is a large community of contributors and users.

item.title: R Modeling Workshop
item.description: What is the point? Data Simple linear regression Moving beyond simple linear regression Interactions Categorical Predictors Predicting Values Binary Outcomes Polynomial Regression Mixed Effects Models The aim of this workshop is to teach you the basics of statistical models in R. The materials for this workshop can be found here. What is the point? When looking at data, we want to determine if there is a relationship between our independent and dependent variables.

item.title: Introduction to LaTeX
item.description: Introduction to LaTeX What is LaTeX? What’s so great about LaTeX? What’s not so great about LaTeX? Editors Basics of LaTeX Important symbols and commands The preamble Document classes Page formatting Packages Body Title page Sections Font styles Figures Tables Bibliographies Other possibilities with LaTeX Introduction to LaTeX What is LaTeX? LaTeX is a document preparation system, that is becoming the de-facto method in STEM fields, such as math, physics and computer science.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
